item.title: Nathan add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Everything is vague to a degree you do not realize till you have tried to make it precise." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Everyone is ignorant, only on different subjects." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I think we ought always to entertain our opinions with some measure of doubt. I shouldn't wish people dogmatically to believe any philosophy, not even mine. " -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Blind belief in authority is the greatest enemy of truth." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But in practice, there is." -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power. If you realize that you have enough, you are truly rich." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Gary Lloyd
item.description: "When the government's boot is on your throat, whether it is a left boot or a right boot is of no consequence." -- Gary Lloyd

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Richard Avedon
item.description: "A portrait is not a likeness. The moment an emotion or fact is transformed into a photograph it is no longer a fact but an opinion. There is no such thing as inaccuracy in a photograph. All photographs are accurate. None of them is the truth. " -- Richard Avedon

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "If there were in the world today any large number of people who desired their own happiness more than they desired the unhappiness of others, we could have paradise in a few years." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Nathan add a quote by C.G. Jung
item.description: "Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes." -- C.G. Jung

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is no remedy for love, but to love more." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Rob Brezsny
item.description: "Imagine the people you fear and dislike as pivotal characters in a fascinating and ultimately redemptive plot that will take years or even lifetimes for the Divine to elaborate." -- Rob Brezsny

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Whatever is rejected from the self, appears in the world as an event." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everything we shut our eyes to, everything we run away from, everything we deny, denigrate, or despise, serves to defeat us in the end." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"Quand tu veux construire un bateau, ne commence pas par rassembler du bois, couper des planches et distribuer du travail, mais reveille au sein des hommes le desir de la mer grande et large.
If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Lin-chi Lu
item.description: "If you love the sacred and despise the ordinary, then you are still bobbing in the ocean of delusion." -- Lin-chi Lu

item.title: Nathan add a quote by John Burroughs
item.description: "Look underfoot. You are always nearer to the true sources of your power than you think. The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are. Don't despise your own place and hour. Every place is the center of the world." -- John Burroughs

item.title: Nathan add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "There is nothing stable in the world; uproar's your only music." -- John Keats

item.title: Nathan add a quote by George Santayana
item.description: "Chaos is a name for any order that produces confusion in our minds." -- George Santayana

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Never confuse Motion with Action." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "We shall find peace. We shall hear angels, we shall see the sky sparkling with diamonds." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "It's really a wonder that I haven't dropped all my ideals, because they seem so absurd and impossible to carry out. Yet I keep them, because in spite of everything, I still believe that people are really good at heart." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Theodore Roethke
item.description: "I lose and find myself in the long water. I am gathered together once more. " -- Theodore Roethke

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Ohne Hast, aber ohne Rast. - Without haste, but without rest." -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "Who of us is mature enough for offspring before the offspring themselves arrive? The value of [parenthood] is not that adults produce children but that children produce adults." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee and just as hard to sleep after." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Nathan add a quote by William Drummond
item.description: "He who will not reason is a bigot; he who cannot is a fool; and he who dares not, is a slave." -- William Drummond

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "It is a waste of energy to be angry with a man who behaves badly, just as it is to be angry with a car that won't go." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts." -- Albert Camus
